text.text_translated:
Born in the USA is a rock album.  
The songs are fast and foot‑tapping.  
The words have emotional weight.  
They talk about the dark side of the American dream.  
The American dream means anyone can be successful.  
Many songs talk about ordinary hard‑working people.  
These people have hard lives.  
They feel anger.  
Life does not give them money or fame.  
One song, Glory Days, is about people in a small town.  
They think about when they were young.  
They felt they could do anything.  
Another song, Downbound Train, is about a young man.  
He loses his job.  
His life becomes very bad.  
The artist is writing about real people he knew.  
He could have had a different life.  
He did not have it because he became a star.  
The album shows the unique and extraordinary talent of the Boss.
